member.name: T:UiPath.Studio.Activities.Api.IRegisterWorkflowDesignApi
member.summary:
Workflow designer API registration. It follows the same pattern as IRegisterMetadata. Studio will scan the types in your assembly for implementations of this interface.
If an implementation is found, an instance is created by Studio and the API instance is handed through .
Note that older Studio versions that do not ship with the API will not be able to load your assembly
If you want to keep the compatibility with the older Studio versions, instead of implementing this interface,
add an Initialize(object) method on the implementation of IRegisterMetadata, that Studio will discover through reflection. Cast the object parameter to on your side
The same instance may be retrieved from the designer context through GetService

member.summary: A wizard implementation.

member.name: P:UiPath.Studio.Activities.Api.Wizards.WizardBase.RunWizard
member.summary: Executes a wizard and returns the resulted activity.

member.name: P:UiPath.Studio.Activities.Api.Wizards.WizardBase.RunWizardWithContainerAsync
member.summary:
Executes a wizard in realtime, allowing it to directly manipulate the workflow it is called on. Takes precedence over , if both are implemented then only this one will be run. The context can be used to retrieve an initially empty target container, part of the workflow, which it can manipulate freely in real time. The return value indicates whether or not the provided container should be kept as part of the workflow. In case the container should be discarded, any operations done on the workflow outside of the container should be cleaned up by the wizard.
Requires feature WizardsV3

member.name: P:UiPath.Studio.Activities.Api.Wizards.WizardBase.RunWizardAsync
member.summary:
Kept for backwards compatibility with 20.4 Preview versions
Requires feature WizardsV3

member.summary: Returns a multi tree of wizard definitions. Each entry is a button on the ribbon. Children for each entry are menu items.

member.summary: Returns a forest of wizard definitions. Their order will define how they appear in the ribbon.

member.summary:

member.name: P:UiPath.Studio.Activities.Api.Wizards.WizardDefinition.RequiredStudioFeature
member.summary:
If null or empty, Studio will add the wizard. If using a product code, Studio will add the wizard if the license contains that code. If using other string, Studio will add the wizard if it knows the string. Anything else, no wizard.
Requires feature WizardsV3
